attributes.action: Remove the 20% VAT that owners of sick pets are forced to pay.
attributes.background: I am a pet owner and live on a small income. My dog has helped me in lots of ways helped me through some tough times. I find 20% VAT on vet operations a rip off by this government for many pet owners and also many of those who are on small pensions.

attributes.action: Allow Tyler Gregory Okonma (A.K.A. Tyler, the Creator) to enter the UK.
attributes.background: The reason for his ban was that his lyrics from an old album were homophobic and encouraged rape, however Mrs May did not realise that he took on a persona and he is not a homophobe nor encourage rape. His setlist does not include these songs and he encourages kids to find their wings, not to rape.
attributes.additional_details: His current setlist accessible via a search engine, his recent album cherry bomb which is not homophobic or misoginistic. http://www.theguardian.com/music/musicblog/2015/sep/01/tyler-the-creator-comments-banned-uk-freedom-of-speech    This article says all. You don't want more distrust for the conservatives do you Mrs May?

attributes.action: Reopen Adcote House, Birkenhead, education unit to assess child's mental health
attributes.background: Adcote house, Birkenhead offers an educational unit with placements to help assess the mental health needs of children and young people. Due to government cut backs the unit is closed and many children including our 7 year old son who would be offered a placement aren't getting their needs met.
attributes.additional_details: Our 7 year old son is having assessments at CAMHS. He is a loving little boy whose emotional and social struggles affect him in everyday life, particularly the school environment. He would now be offered a 6 week educational placement at Adcote house to further assess his needs and get him the support he deserves. Frustratingly, he along with so many other children aren't getting their needs met due to government cut backs. Please help reopen a lifeline for families in already difficult times.

attributes.action: Open up the 16-24 age bracket for the Creative Employment Programme to 30+
attributes.background: The Creative Employment Programme is a £15m fund to support the creation of traineeships, formal apprenticeship and paid internship opportunities in England for young unemployed people aged 16-24 wishing to pursue a career in the arts and cultural sector.
attributes.additional_details:
This age cap should be opened up to at least 30 years old as is unfair to anyone over the age of 24 trying to get an entry level position within creative industries. This policy is ageist and due to it's popularity with employers able to get funding to support the job position there are many jobs that cannot be obtained by people over 24 purely because of their age.

The position should go to the person that best fits the job role and not to how old they are.

attributes.action: Review the Foreign Aid Policy  relating to Syrian refugees
attributes.background: Petition the government to review the Foreign Aid to the Syrian refugee’s estimated at £1.2 billion  when there are UK taxpayers, pensioners, families, people with chronic health conditions, and  homeless people who are reliant on handouts from food banks and charities to live a meagre existence.

attributes.action: An unelected Prime Minister should call a general election within 6 months
attributes.background: In the interests of sovereignty, an unelected UK Prime Minister should hold a general election within six months of taking office.

attributes.action: We want a points-based immigration system similar to Australia
attributes.background: This is your chance to make a change. We just want a means of regulating immigration to the United Kingdom. We are 'not racist' we need control. We need 1,000,000 signatures to stop this open boarders system and crazy immigration that is destroying Great Britain.
attributes.additional_details: 1. A failure to curb migration is corrosive of public trust in politics. 2. Voters had been promised that annual net immigration could be cut to the tens of thousands. 3. Net migration to Britain reached 333,000 in 2015, the second-highest level for a year since records began in 1975. We need your help.

attributes.action: Call for Parliament to end tax-free status for ALL religious organisations in UK
attributes.background: Religion, whether you believe in it or not, is a business. It always has, and always will be. In 2013 the Church of England's revenue was £1.41 billion; taxed at just 5% would have generated £70,000,000! This is ONE religion in ONE year..! If there is a God, wouldn't he want to help our country...?
attributes.additional_details: As somebody who is fundamentally non-religious, I have always been amazed at the tax-free statuses of religious organisations. Even if God IS real, why should his representatives not pay tax? Their reason: They provide crucial social services, and that 200 years of church tax exemptions have not turned us into a theocracy. Taxing religious organisations won't make us a theocracy, especially if they're ALL taxed. Hospitals also provide social service, they're taxed; so why not religions..?

attributes.action: Make  UK licensed bookmakers accept bets up to a minimum liability of £1000
attributes.background: It has become a common practice for bookmakers within the UK and those  that operate in the UK to restrict or close the account of  customers and / or to exempt some customers from participating in advertised promotions or enhanced  offers. These  widespread practises are unfair and  discriminate.
attributes.additional_details:
Special Terms should continue to be allowed to  apply to enhanced offers and  advertised promotions which may limit bet size  but changes must be made for all customers to be able to participate , without exclusion or  discrimination.

New South Wales, Australia  has recognised these  inequities  and has legislated to introduced the type of  regulation  we ask for in this petition.

attributes.action: Make the new £155 pension rate available to existing pensioners in April.
attributes.background: I and several friends over the age of 65 have paid more than the now required 30 years of contributions but will not receive the new £155 pension in April. I personally have paid conributions for 42 years but will receive no refund of my 12 years extra payment. Some have paid more. This is unfair.

attributes.action: Enforce use of stun guns in halal slaughterhouses.
attributes.background:
We are a nation of animal lovers..yet we allow animals to endure horrific, painful deaths on our soil. 
The animals in halal slaughter houses who do not use stunguns, flail and scream in pain for up to 5 minutes before they die. THIS IS NOT NECESSARY FOR HALAL.
attributes.additional_details:
There a number of sickening videos online of animals dying horrific deaths in halal slaughterhouses..i strongly reccommend you view these to understand fully the emergence of this petition.
There are also articles written by top muslim scholars who agree that stunning the animal does not go against the rules in the Qu'ran. To kill an animal with a blow to the head is forbidden, but to stun them with stungun (which is placed on the head) is permitted.
 The animal is still alive and the blood will still pump out as is necessary for halal meat.

attributes.action: Investigate the appalling service provided by Southern Rail during 2016
attributes.background: This year many trains have been cancelled by this company outside of industrial action. The company have cited staff shortages. But this is happening every day of every week. Surely their planning &/or HR department should & could have seen this coming.
attributes.additional_details: Only today two trains have been cancelled on the southern network. The 08:09 Southampton central & 08:30 Chichester. Many people rely on these services including school children who may be left venerable waiting on platforms when their parents are expecting them at a different time. This is a shocking service and needs to be resolved.

attributes.action: Decrease the amount universities can charge students for their tuition fees.
attributes.background: It is well known how much debt students will be left with once they have graduated from their respective degrees. It is time for parliament to review the maximum amount of tuition fees being charged to students in the U.K, as well as offering more financial support to those from low income families.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/education-34721681
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/education-26954901
http://www.independent.co.uk/student/news/jeremy-corbyn-england-should-be-utterly-ashamed-of-having-highest-tuition-fees-in-industrialised-a6860556.html

attributes.action: Life Imprisonment for the abuse, neglect and ill-treatment of children.
attributes.background: After reading of yet another child abused and eventually dying at the hands of the person who should have cared for her, we know in the past, sentencing in similar situations is lenient. If life imprisonment is mandatory upon conviction, it may act as a deterrent or stop the continuing abuse

attributes.action: The government must ensure schools provide instrumental lessons for all pupils
attributes.background: It has been proved beyond question that the experience of learning a musical instrument and playing in musical ensembles with others provides a complete 'brain work out' - developing skills that are not just related to music but also skills that enhance both learning and development throughout life
attributes.additional_details: There have been numerous studies showing the cognitive development of children who play an instrument when compared to those that don't and all the evidence makes it quite clear that the the benefits of learning a musical instrument helps education and development in all subjects for everyone as the skills required for instrumental playing are all essential skills in everyday life.

attributes.action: Guidance on workplace bullying must be applied to behaviour of MPs at work.
attributes.background: The rules covering conduct during parliamentary debate must be updated to reflect the level of conduct expected generally in the workplace.
attributes.additional_details:
We would like our representatives to treat each other with respect, to listen properly to each others views, to debate the matter at hand and to answer direct questions with full and truthful answers.

("Bullying may be characterised as offensive, intimidating, malicious or insulting behaviour, an abuse or misuse of power through means that undermine, humiliate, denigrate or injure the recipient." - From the ACAS website)

attributes.action: Give legal immunity to military personal who fought in Iraq and Afghanistan.
attributes.background: The current legal witch hunt of our military personnel who fought in Iraq and Afghanistan is wholly unacceptable and I call upon the government to bring a stop to criminalising our veterans and damaging the military covenant even more than it already is.
attributes.additional_details: American military personnel are protected by their government from such things, why not ours?

attributes.action: Clean Up City Air: Ban Harmful Diesel Engined, Air-Polluting Public Transport
attributes.background: Public transport should not cause harm to public health. Diesel exhaust is one of the biggest causes of air pollution, which is linked to 40,000 early deaths every year, causing diseases including cancer, dementia, and heart disease. It is time for a healthy alternative energy for public transport.
attributes.additional_details: The Royal College of Physicians recently stated "The health problems resulting from exposure to air pollution have a high cost to society and business, our health services, and people who suffer from illness and premature death. In the UK, these costs add up to more than £20 billion every year.  Taking action will reduce pain, suffering and demands on the NHS, while getting people back to work, learning, and an active life. The value of these benefits far exceeds the cost of reducing emissions."

attributes.action: Introduce NHS funding for Forensic Psychology doctorate students
attributes.background: The NHS funds Clinical Psychology doctoral students so that they are able to complete their training whilst earning a fair salary. This means that anyone can apply to do the Clinical Psychology doctorate. The Forensic Psychology doctorate is not only NOT funded, but must be paid for (over £7000/yr).
attributes.additional_details: The Forensic Psychology doctorate is a professional training course during which you are on placement full-time, whilst also conducting thesis research. However, the full-time work that students undertake on placements (often within NHS establishments, e.g. secure hospitals) is completely unpaid. This means that Forensic Psychology doctorate students have to find a way to pay the course fees and be able to work for free for 2 years. I believe the Forensic Doctorate should be funded by the NHS.

attributes.action: Force Govia Thameslink Railway to pay compensation to all season ticket
attributes.background:
I call on the government to force Govia Thameslink Railway to pay monetary compensation to all season ticket holders on Southern operated routes at a level of 20% of their season ticket value. 

GTR recently cut 350 services from all lines added to previous disruption, customers need compensating
attributes.additional_details: Www.bbc.Co.uk/news/uk-england-36701300

attributes.action: Cancel the Validity of the EU referendum as the government held it illegally.
attributes.background: No votes for European residents but votes for Commonwealth residents. None for long standing Brits living elsewhere in the EU. The result is too marginal to call decisive. The 2 million EU citizens working and living  in the UK directly affected by this should be given a vote at a new referendum.
attributes.additional_details:
Referendums are one off events, so the rules about who can vote are different each time. www.electoralcommission.org.uk

Millions of EU UK Citizens have helped this country be the success it has been. A set of voting eligibility rules should have been laid out for EU citizens who have been here a certain amount of time, made the UK their home and contributed.

attributes.action: Allow Practice nurses employed prior to 6/3/1990 to retain Special Class Status
attributes.background: Because I became a practice nurse prior to 6/3/98 I have lost my right to retire without penalties at 55yrs, despite never having a break in my career. SCS nurses entering into General Practice after 6/3/1990 are entitled to retire at 55yrs, if they have not had a break of more than 5 years.
attributes.additional_details: Many nurses that have paid into the NHS pension scheme without a break of more than 5 years have the right to retire at the age of 55 years without penalty(this right was abolished for new nurses after 6/3/1995).  GP nurses were excluded from the pension scheme until 1/9/1997 so many have incurred a forced break of more than 5 yrs.(A period of time 6/3/95 - 31/8/97 is ignored) For those employed in GP work prior to 6/3/1990 the SCS has been removed and is unfair.

attributes.action: DNA test and fingerprint needles left in the street, and prosecute the criminal
attributes.background: The public get stabbed by needles left in the street by drug users and have to wait 6 months to see If they caught HIV or Hepatitis A/B/C. Drug users who throw their needles on the street should be prosecuted with a minimum sentence. A simple test for DNA and fingerprinting will catch the criminal.
attributes.additional_details: The two techniques are used for very small crimes such as vehicle interference or trespassing. Sin bins and needle exchange has been provided for drug users as we understand their addiction therefore they is no excuse to put the public in danger of diseases. Children play on the street innocently because they are unaware of the risk of a needle which could change their life forever, smoking in the same car as a child is child abuse therefore how come giving a child a disease isn't abuse.

attributes.action: Stop the dismantling of the Corsellis brain bank at St. Bernard's Hospital.
attributes.background:
The Corsellis Brain bank took almost 50 years to build and was hugely important in research into illnesses such as epilepsy, CJD, schizophrenia, bipolar disorder and dementia.  
The West London Mental Health Trust is dismantling it for no purpose, as storing it would cost less than dismantling.
attributes.additional_details:
The WLMHT R&D site can be found here:
http://www.wlmht.nhs.uk/about-wlmht/research/contact-rd/ 

A detailed history of the collection can be found here:
http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/20817923 
 
The public announcement of its dismantling:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b06r5d0h 

It is stored at St. Bernard's Hospital under the authority of the West London Mental Health Trust.  After ten years of redevelopment the collection is now being dismantled, rendering it largely useless.

attributes.action: All teachers to undertake mental health training before going in the profession
attributes.background: There are too many cases of teachers missing the signs of a child going through depression, eating disorders, ect. If all teachers were to be trained before going into the profession, it would allow the child to receive support and help. The earliest a teacher can recognise this, the better.

attributes.action: Evaluate health outcomes from a pilot of the new junior doctor contracts
attributes.background: Modern medical practice is based on critical reading of the evidence. The proposed changes to junior doctor contracts are based on an uncritical interpretation of research into weekend health outcomes, and are intended to lead to an untried extension of non-urgent procedures into weekends.
attributes.additional_details: “Our analysis of 2013-14 data suggests that around 11 000 more people die each year within 30 days of admission to hospital on Friday, Saturday, Sunday, or Monday compared with other days of the week (Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday). It is not possible to ascertain the extent to which these excess deaths may be preventable; to assume that they are avoidable would be rash and misleading.” (Freemantle et al 2015, BMJ)

attributes.action: Make First Aid compulsory in schools and colleges.
attributes.background: A lot of school students do not know any First Aid. This is important that everybody learns and knows how to do First Aid. If they're in a situation and someone needs First Aid in the streets, the students will know how to treat the person. They would be able to treat until the ambulance arrives.

attributes.action: Wants the government to ban the tampon tax
attributes.background: As a young woman living in the 21st century, it is an absolute disgrace that our government is making us pay for a NECESSITY. The tax cost the average women an approximate £18,450. This can be one extra year of education or a start up business.

attributes.action: Make the provision of free public toilets a legal requirement for local councils
attributes.background: Public toilets are not legally require to be provided by local authorities, which means that they are often closed to save money. As urinating or defecating on the street is illegal it effectively means that a person has to spend money in a private establishment in order to use the toilets.
attributes.additional_details:
"Joan Dean said her husband Brian, who has Parkinson's Disease, was left humiliated when he wet himself after failing to find a toilet on a trip to Levenshulme, in Manchester, where 18 toilets have been closed in the last 10 years."

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-36405414

People who are vulnerable, ill, homeless or on low income might not be able to use private facilities yet face legal action if they urinate or defecate on the street. This is an affront to dignity and needs to be addressed.

attributes.action: Bring baby boxes to Britain
attributes.background: BBC news Vanessa Barford (2016) wrote a brilliant article discussing the benefits to baby boxes in Finland. Since the boxes were introduced cot death dropped significantly in Finland and now Finland has the lowest mortality rates in the World.
attributes.additional_details: Barford (2016) stated that It's a tradition that dates back to the 1930s. Every new mother, regardless of background or income, gets a baby box from the government. The box contains a stash of supplies - bibs, bodysuits, nappies, a sleeping bag, outdoor gear, bathing products - as well as a small mattress. Putting the mattress in the bottom of the box creates the baby's first bed.

attributes.action: We call for a debate to discuss how more disabled people can be elected as MPs
attributes.background: People with disabilities are the least represented group in parliament yet they are disproportionately adversely affected by Government policies and decisions.  We believe it is time this and future governments make every effort to ensure people with disabilities are fairly represented in Parliament

attributes.action: To scrap p.i.p and reinstate DLA and DWA for disabled people with medical proof
attributes.background: I was born with deformed and dislocated hips ,which has caused osteo arthritis in my hips,knees , spine and my spine is curved.The government have lied about cutting allowances ,I now can't afford a car ,have a blue parking badge ,or trade my own fire risk zafira for a motability car.losing my home.
attributes.additional_details: Genuine disabled people are becoming housebound and suicidal due to having their disabilities downgraded in the new p.I.p assessments from high mobility to standard mobility ,this enables the government to stop you having the blue parking badge , free road tax and a motability car .if that's not cutting our allowances what is ???

attributes.action: No higher rate stamp duty, up front, for people who are buying / selling a home.
attributes.background: From April 1 2016, if you buy a new home and have not yet managed to sell your current home, for any reason, you will have to pay the higher rate of stamp duty UPFRONT. On a £250,000 purchase, you will have to pay £10,000 stamp duty instead of the normal amount of £2,500. See example, below:
attributes.additional_details:
D and E are purchasing a property jointly which is intended to be their main residence. E already owns a property, which was previously used as a main residence, which he will not have sold at the time of purchase - even though it is for sale. Upon purchase, as E will own two properties and has not replaced his main residence, the higher rates will apply. 

You get a refund of the higher rate if one of the property is sold within 18 months.

It is unfair to have to pay the higher rate upfront.

attributes.action: Allow British citizens living abroad to vote at an Embassy
attributes.background: British citizens living abroad are currently only able to vote by post, proxy or in person in the UK. Postal votes frequently fail to arrive and voting by proxy or in person is often impossible. Citizens abroad need to be able to vote in an embassy, an option for many other countries.
attributes.additional_details: British citizens living abroad are often denied their right to vote on matters affecting them. This occurs as postal votes frequently fail to arrive, and if they arrive at all, votes typically have insufficient time to return to the UK. British citizens living abroad should have the right to vote in, or return a postal vote to, an embassy in their country of residence. This is an option offered in many other countries and would allow those living abroad to have a voice.

attributes.action: Amend the Investigatory Powers Bill (IP Bill) to meet international standards.
attributes.background: The Investigatory Powers Bill (IP Bill) fails to meet international standards. By allowing surveillance without reasonable suspicion, it compromises the fundamental right to privacy as outlined in Article 12 of the Human Rights Act. We ask that the bill is revised to defend our human rights.

attributes.action: Give gay men the same right as everybody else in terms of giving blood
attributes.background: Gay men currently have to wait one year after having sex to give blood. This is not fair or equal and brings inequality to the UK as well as homophobia. A simple screening test for all andstopping everyone having sex a week before becoming a donor could be a way to bring fairness to resolve this.

attributes.action: Change UK Immigration Policy so that families like the Brains may reside here.
attributes.background: The Brain Family in Dingwall moved over from Australia under a visa programme that was subsequently revoked without any exceptions being made for them.  After much publicity and support from their MP and the First Minister of Scotland, their stay has been extended but are prohibited from employment.
attributes.additional_details:
UK Government policy on immigration should be changed to take due account of the following:

-     Where people have resettled here at considerable personal expense under a previous immigration programme.

-      Whether people come from Commonwealth countries where the Queen is Head of State.

-      The opinions and recommendations of their local elected representatives and of the Leader of the democratically-elected devolved Government should carry an appropriate level of weighting by UK Gov.

attributes.action: Make the use of mobile phones while driving an instant driving ban.
attributes.background: Everyone now knows it's illegal yet the problem is growing, people are dying and being seriously injured in increasing numbers. I drive for a living and am amazed daily by this problem, drivers texting while driving on motorways is just one I see almost daily.needs treating same as drink driving

attributes.action: Help me get back nhs ivf for mid and north east essex
attributes.background: Me and my husband were given the news we needed little help for our dream of a baby we needed ivf as this was no longer availble on nhs we would have to pay thousands which is not practical... they offer nothing they used to offer 3 cycles now they offer none....this is so wrong please sign....
attributes.additional_details: I want action because I believe the people of mid and north east essex have had there human rights taken away as the gift of a child is invaluable and to have that right taken away is not right and needs to be looked at by the government I understsnd the nhs struggles but from 3 cycles offered to none.this is not right please help us people of essex...... nice guidlines state 3 cycles should be offered surely they should be followed...please help and get this to the government. . Thanku

attributes.action: Introduce charges on plastic & polystyrene containers for the takeaway industry
attributes.background: I would like to place a charge on every plastic and polystyrene container used by the food industries and takeaway industries like the plastic bag charges brought in. Hopefully this will push people to use the eco-friendly products that are on the market but that are over looked due to the prices.
attributes.additional_details: Each container costs 2p more but the plastic and polystyrene ones cost in landfill which is problem that needs facing. As a people we need to change our views on looking after this planet and the swap across to these products is a big step in the right direction. I feel that the takeaway industry is a major contributor in regards to plastic and polystyrene waste and should be addressed like the plastic bag issue was. We are running out of time to turn this world into the wonder it should be.

attributes.action: Make electronic dog collars illegal to own and use in the UK.
attributes.background: Electronic dog collars are an outdated form of torture to help control dog barking through pain and fear. They have no place in society where other affordable options are widely available. A substantial fine and prison sentence should be the punishment for this form of animal cruelty.

attributes.action: The UK will not leave the single market without a further referendum.
attributes.background: Throughout the referendum campaign, the public has been promised that full access to the single market can be maintained and it was on this basis that the narrow "Leave" victory margin (52/48) was achieved. It would be catastrophic for the UK economy if this access were given up or diluted.

attributes.action: Create a permanent and separate role of 'Minister for Mental Health'
attributes.background: I am writing this petition to ask the Secretary of State for Health Jeremy Hunt and Prime Minister David Cameron to create a 'Minister for Mental Health'. I know personally the devastating effects that mental health problems can have, both myself and within my family. It needs taking seriously.
attributes.additional_details: The current minister for 'Community and Social Care' Alistair Burt has numerous other areas of health to look after, which means that his full attention is not focused on this crucial area. There is still too little being done to reduce stigma, even with the government's promise to increase funding and awareness. I think a 'Minister for Mental Health' would have more control over the mental health budget and drastically improve care for our most vulnerable citizens.

attributes.action: Reduce the minimum drinking alcohol age to 17
attributes.background: I think that there a lot of underage drinkers who are heavily drinking out of control because they aren't legal to do it. I think this is more harmful then beneficial if they are legally allowed to drink alcohol they won't feel that drinking alcohol is a big deal preventing them breaking the law.
attributes.additional_details: There is evidence that the young adults who grow up the most rebellious are the ones who have had a really strict upbringing where they weren't allowed much freedom. I believe this is the same with alcohol, withholding it will only make them want it more.If your old enough to drive a car you should be old enough to drink alcohol. Driving a car is a risk to other people lives on a daily basis however, alcohol only involves the person who drinks it.

attributes.action: MPs should not earn money or otherwise work outside of their role as MP
attributes.background: Too often MPs work for the benefit of private industries instead of for the public good. Being an MP should be a privilege, an opportunity to serve. While an MP's salary should not be so low as to exclude people from less well off backgrounds it should not be a subsidy for careerists.

attributes.action: To appoint an independent judicial body to review the EU referendum campaign
attributes.background: There have been considerable concerns regarding the statements that were made during the EU referendum campaign & then their subsequent retraction. Our aim is to investigate & hopefully to establish why such things happened during the course of the campaign & to learn the lessons for the future.
attributes.additional_details:
We propose that the House of Commons appoints an independent judicial committee, comprised of senior Commonwealth judges, to review claimed deceptions in the campaigns leading up to the poll of 23 June 2016 on the UK’s membership of the European Union.

Given the advisory nature of the referendum, this would enable a review of the alleged deceptions and their impact on voters, with the findings reported to Parliament- the ultimate arbiter on when article 50 should be implemented.

attributes.action: Remove or reduce Parliament’s recess dates
attributes.background: Every year the Government shuts down on several occasions, including a near two-month recess in the summer. The country does not shut down for the summer, but the Houses of Parliament do. We propose that the Government bring themselves in line with the rest of the country and sits during the summer.
attributes.additional_details:
For a 7 day NHS, the Government argues that it is in the best interest to have a 7 day service as illness does not stop at the weekend. The same is true for the country. The country does not have a summer break, so the Government should not either. 

About the recess, Labour’s Margaret Hodge stated in 2013 “We are not spending enough time in Westminster, and this creates a democratic vacuum. The executive can go on and you cannot hold them to the account. It feels as if we are hardly working."

attributes.action: Stop Roosh Vorek entering the UK
attributes.background: Roosh Vorek, known as Roosh V, is a blogger who writes guidebooks for sex tourists and has argued for rape to be legalised on private property.
attributes.additional_details:
The 36-year-old American is planning to host a series of "international meet-ups" in cities including Edinburgh and Glasgow.

According to Vorek's website, only heterosexual men will be allowed at the meetings, the locations of which will remain secret until 8pm on Saturday evening.

Campaigners say Vorek's views constitute hate speech and have called for the Scottish Government to ban the meetings.

attributes.action: Motorcycle filtering signs.
attributes.background: to lower the risk of deaths and near misses on the UK motorways, filtering signs to be placed on the gang ways above motorways or on the side of roads informing other motorists to look out for bikes. Also stipulate the legal filtering speed limits in the highway code.
attributes.additional_details: Due to the amount of motorcycle deaths and/or near misses on the UK roads down to filtering, as a road safety intensive nation wide I feel the government should introduce a filtering sign along UK roads, to remind other road users of filtering bikes and the legalities (stated in section 88 of the highway code) to be move vigilant for filtering motorcycles.

attributes.action: Reduce the rate of Value Added Tax in the UK from the current 20% to 15%.
attributes.background: The cost of living for the majority of UK citizens is punitive. The lowest band of income tax rate at 20% is unaffordable for many. The tax free bands are too low. Families are homeless and hungry. If companies are to get tax breaks, citizens should too. Reduction in VAT will stimulate the economy.
